gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCEI > National Centers for Environmental Information, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce
Space Weather Prediction Center, National Centers for Environmental Prediction, National Weather Service (NOAA)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Collection includes presentation materials and outputs from operational space environment models produced by the NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center (SWPC) and other related model datasets. Included are; 1) regional space environment specifications of the atmospheric total electon content (TEC) for the continental United States (CONUS), 2) global specifications of ionospheric D-region (radio-wave) absorption and 3) interplanetary solar-wind specifications for predicting the propagation and arrival times of geoeffective coronal mass ejections (CME). Also included is a 30-year space environment climatogy produced by the NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information (formerly NGDC).

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: To provide scientific data stewardship of solar-terrestrial datasets in compliance with NOAA Administrative Order (NAO) 212-15, "Management of Environmental and Geospatial Data and Information", dated 04 Nov 10. Scientific Data Stewardship includes the Archive, Access, and Assessment (AAA) of operational and related solar and space environmental datasets.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Data access provided by the NOAA Solar and Terrestrial Physics Division.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The information provided on this page seeks to define how the GCMD Keywords are structured, used and accessed. It also provides information on how users can participate in the further development of the keywords.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: None Use Constraints: None Distribution Liability: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCEI > National Centers for Environmental Information, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The NOAA Solar and Terrestrial Physics (STP) Division is responsible for the archive and access of solar and space environmental data and derived products collected by NOAA observing systems and acquired through the World Data System. Archives include extensive collections of data from solar observatories, ground ionospheric sounders, and satellites plus modeled space climatologies.

gmd:fees.gco:CharacterString: Data can be downloaded free of charge from the NOAA Solar and Terrestrial Physics (STP) division.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The NOAA Solar and Terrestrial Physics (STP) division is responsible for the archive and access of solar and space environmental data and derived products collected by NOAA observing systems and acquired through the World Data Center for Solar and Terrestrial Physics (Boulder). Archives include extensive collections of data from solar observatories, ground ionospheric sounders, and satellites plus modeled space climatologies.

gmd:other.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA created the National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) by merging NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), and National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), including the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC), per the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, Public Law 113-235. NCEI launched publicly on April 22, 2015.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Operational space environment model products provide contiguous coverage within the specified temporal extent.
Operational space environment models presented in consistent domain specifications.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Operational space environment models presented in consistent conceptual specifications.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Operational space environment models presented in consistent format specifications.
Operational space environment models presented in well known solar and geospace geometries.
Operational space environment models managed by trained professional staff within the NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center (SWPC).
Operational space environment models presented in well known solar and geospace geometrical grids.
Operational space environent model results reviewed by trained professional staff within the NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center (SWPC).

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Operational space environment models are processed on computer systems managed by the Space Weather Prediction Center and related National Center for Environmental Prediction (SWPC) within the National weather Service(NWS).
The NOAA Solar and Terrestrial Physics (STP) division is responsible for managing this collection.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Space Weather Models: U.S. Total Electron Content (US-TEC)

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: . The Space Weather Prediction Center (SWPC) is part of the National Weather Service and is one of the nine National Centers for Environmental Prediction. It is the nation's official source of space weather alerts, watches and warnings. SWPC provides real-time monitoring and forecasting of solar and geophysical events which impact satellites, power grids, communications, navigation, and many other technological systems. SWPC also explores and evaluates new models and products and transitions them into operations. SWPC is also the primary warning center for the International Space Environment Service and works with many national and international partners with whom data, products, and services are shared.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Space Weather Models: D-Region Absorption Product

SWPC also explores and evaluates new models and products and transitions them into operations. SWPC is also the primary warning center for the International Space Environment Service and works with many national and international partners with whom data, products, and services are shared.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: . The Solar and Terrestrial Physics (STP) division of NGDC provides scientific stewardship of NOAA's space weather data and products, geomagnetic observatory and station data, and Nighttime observations of the Earth.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: This metadata was automatically generated from the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata: Extensions for Remote Sensing Metadata standard version FGDC-STD-012-2002 using the June 2011 version of the FGDC RSE to ISO 19115-2 transform. The Spatial Reference Information is not currently mapped over to ISO but will be mapped in future versions.
This record was automatically modified on 2015-10-02 to include references to NCEI where applicable.

gmd:code.gco:nilReason: National Centers for Environmental Prediction (NCEP) Central Operations

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: NCEP delivers national and global weather, water, climate and space weather guidance, forecasts, warnings and analyses to its Partners and External User Communities. These products and services are based on a service-science legacy and respond to user needs to protect life and property, enhance the nation's economy and support the nation's growing need for environmental information.

gmi:type.gco:CharacterString: Operational Space Environment Models are run on computer resource sytems managed by the NOAA National Centers for Environmental Prediction.
